translations.text: By those (angels) that pluck out the soul from depths,
and gently take it away;
and by those that speedily glide along (the cosmos),
and vie with the others(in carrying out their Lord's behests);
and then manage the affairs of the Universe(according to their Lord's commands).<sup foot_note="182548">1</sup>
The Day when the quaking will cause a violent convulsion,
and will be followed by another quaking.<sup foot_note="182549">1</sup>
On that Day some hearts shall tremble (with fright),<sup foot_note="182550">1</sup>
and their eyes shall be downcast with dread.
They say: “Shall we indeed be restored to life,
even after we have been reduced to bones, hollow and rotten?”
They say: “That will then be a return with a great loss!”<sup foot_note="182551">1</sup>
Surely they will need no more than a single stern blast,
and lo, they will all be in the open plain.<sup foot_note="182552">1</sup>
Has<sup foot_note="182553">1</sup> Moses' story reached you?
When his Lord called him in the sacred valley of Tuwa,<sup foot_note="182554">1</sup>
and directed him: “Go to Pharaoh, he has rebelled,
and say to him: 'Are you willing to be purified,
that I may direct you to your Lord and then you hold Him<sup foot_note="182555">1</sup> in awe?' ”
Then Moses (went to Pharaoh and) showed him the Great Sign;<sup foot_note="182556">1</sup>
but he denied it as false and disobeyed,
and then he turned back to have recourse to his craftiness,<sup foot_note="182557">1</sup>
and gathered his people and declared:<sup foot_note="182558">1</sup>
“I am the supreme lord of you all.”
Thereupon Allah seized him for the chastisement of the World to Come as well as of the present.
Surely there is a great lesson in it for whoever would fear (Allah).<sup foot_note="182559">1</sup>
Is<sup foot_note="182560">1</sup> it harder to create you or the heaven?<sup foot_note="182561">2</sup> But Allah built it,
and raised its vault high and proportioned it;
and covered its night with darkness and brought forth from it its day;<sup foot_note="182562">1</sup>
and thereafter spread out the earth,<sup foot_note="182563">1</sup>
and brought out of it its water and its pasture,<sup foot_note="182564">1</sup>
and firmly fixed in it mountains;
all this as provision for you and your cattle.<sup foot_note="182565">1</sup>
But when the great calamity will come about<sup foot_note="182566">1</sup>
on the Day when man will recall all his strivings,<sup foot_note="182567">1</sup>
and Hell will be brought in sight for anyone to see:
then he who transgressed
and preferred the life of this world,
most surely his abode shall be Hell.
But he who feared to stand before his Lord, and restrained himself from evil desires,
most surely his abode shall be Paradise.<sup foot_note="182568">1</sup>
They ask you about the Hour: “When will it be?”<sup foot_note="182569">1</sup>
What concern do you have to speak about that?
Its knowledge rests with your Lord.
You are only a warner to him who has a fear of it.<sup foot_note="182570">1</sup>
On the Day they see it, they will feel as though they had stayed (in the grave) no more than one evening or one morning.<sup foot_note="182571">1</sup>
